p: We hope this study will spur further research into this topic, especially in areas less explored, such as the impacts of the European debt crisis on health, and the long-term trade-offs and unintended consequences austerity can have on the environment and human health. This is an especially important topic when considering we are facing multiple threats brought about by global warming and other anthropogenic induced changes that can benefit emerging diseases, i.e., global trade in wild animals, intensive agriculture/animal rearing and land use conversion.
